kickstart.post:
getent group etcd > /dev/null || groupadd -r etcd getent passwd etcd > /dev/null || useradd -r -g etcd -d /var/lib/etcd \ -s /sbin/nologin -c "etcd user" etcd
mkdir -p /var/lib/etcd chown -R etcd:etcd /var/lib/etcd
[Unit] Description=etcd After=network.target After=network-online.target Wants=network-online.target
[Service] Type=notify WorkingDirectory=/var/lib/etcd/ #EnvironmentFile=-/opt/kubernetes/etc/etcd.conf ExecStart=/opt/kubernetes/bin/etcd --config-file /opt/kubernetes/etc/etcd.conf User=etcd Restart=always RestartSec=10 LimitNOFILE=65536
[Install] WantedBy=multi-user.target
# This is the configuration file for the etcd server.
# Human-readable name for this member. name: '&hostname;.&domainname;'
# Path to the data directory. data-dir: /var/lib/etcd/default.etcd
# Path to the dedicated wal directory. wal-dir:
# Number of committed transactions to trigger a snapshot to disk. snapshot-count: 10000
# Time (in milliseconds) of a heartbeat interval. heartbeat-interval: 100
# Time (in milliseconds) for an election to timeout. election-timeout: 1000
# Raise alarms when backend size exceeds the given quota. 0 means use the # default quota. quota-backend-bytes: 0
# List of comma separated URLs to listen on for peer traffic. listen-peer-urls: https://&hostaddr;:2380
# List of comma separated URLs to listen on for client traffic. listen-client-urls: https://&hostaddr;:2379,https://127.0.0.1:2379
# Maximum number of snapshot files to retain (0 is unlimited). max-snapshots: 5
# Maximum number of wal files to retain (0 is unlimited). max-wals: 5
# Comma-separated white list of origins for CORS (cross-origin resource sharing). cors:
# List of this member's peer URLs to advertise to the rest of the cluster. # The URLs needed to be a comma-separated list. initial-advertise-peer-urls: https://&hostaddr;:2380
# List of this member's client URLs to advertise to the public. # The URLs needed to be a comma-separated list. advertise-client-urls: https://&hostaddr;:2379
# Discovery URL used to bootstrap the cluster. discovery:
# Valid values include 'exit', 'proxy' discovery-fallback: 'proxy'
# HTTP proxy to use for traffic to discovery service. discovery-proxy:
# DNS domain used to bootstrap initial cluster. discovery-srv:
# Initial cluster configuration for bootstrapping.
import stack.api as api import stack.commands as cmd
actions = api.Call('report.host.attr', ['attr=etcd.cluster_member', 'pydict=True'])
nodes = [] for a in actions: node = a.split(':')[-0].strip() val = a.split(':')[-1].strip() if cmd.str2bool(val) == True: ip = api.Call('report.host.attr',[node,'attr=hostaddr']) url = '%s.&domainname;=https://%s:2380' % (node,ip[0]) # url = 'https://%s:2380' % (ip[0]) nodes.append(url) print 'initial-cluster:', ','.join(nodes[:])
# Initial cluster token for the etcd cluster during bootstrap. initial-cluster-token: 'etcd-cluster'
# Initial cluster state ('new' or 'existing'). initial-cluster-state: 'new'
# Reject reconfiguration requests that would cause quorum loss. strict-reconfig-check: false
# Valid values include 'on', 'readonly', 'off' proxy: 'off'
# Time (in milliseconds) an endpoint will be held in a failed state. proxy-failure-wait: 5000
# Time (in milliseconds) of the endpoints refresh interval. proxy-refresh-interval: 30000
# Time (in milliseconds) for a dial to timeout. proxy-dial-timeout: 1000
# Time (in milliseconds) for a write to timeout. proxy-write-timeout: 5000
# Time (in milliseconds) for a read to timeout. proxy-read-timeout: 0
client-transport-security: # DEPRECATED: Path to the client server TLS CA file. ca-file:
# Path to the client server TLS cert file. cert-file: /opt/kubernetes/etc/certs.d/etcd-server.pem
# Path to the client server TLS key file. key-file: /opt/kubernetes/etc/certs.d/etcd-server-key.pem
# Enable client cert authentication. client-cert-auth: true
# Path to the client server TLS trusted CA key file. trusted-ca-file: /opt/kubernetes/etc/certs.d/ca.pem
# Client TLS using generated certificates auto-tls: false
peer-transport-security: # DEPRECATED: Path to the peer server TLS CA file. ca-file:
# Path to the peer server TLS cert file. cert-file: /opt/kubernetes/etc/certs.d/etcd-member.pem
# Path to the peer server TLS key file. key-file: /opt/kubernetes/etc/certs.d/etcd-member-key.pem
# Enable peer client cert authentication. client-cert-auth: true
# Path to the peer server TLS trusted CA key file. trusted-ca-file: /opt/kubernetes/etc/certs.d/ca.pem
# Peer TLS using generated certificates. auto-tls: false
# Enable debug-level logging for etcd. debug: true
# Specify a particular log level for each etcd package (eg: 'etcdmain=CRITICAL,etcdserver=DEBUG'. log-package-levels:
# Force to create a new one member cluster. force-new-cluster: false
systemctl enable etcd

chmod 755 /usr/share/flannel/mk-docker-opts.sh
FLANNEL_ETCD_PREFIX="--etcd-prefix=&etcd.prefix;" FLANNEL_ETCD_CAFILE="--etcd-cafile=/op/kubernetes/etc/etcd-server.pem" FLANNEL_ETCD_CERTFILE="--etcd-keyfile=/op/kubernetes/etc/etcd-server-key.pem" FLANNEL_ETCD_KEYFILE="--etcd-certfile=/op/kubernetes/etc/etcd-server.pem"
import stack.api as api import stack.commands as cmd
actions = api.Call('report.host.attr', ['attr=etcd.cluster_member', 'pydict=True'])
urls = [] for a in actions: node = a.split(':')[-0].strip() val = a.split(':')[-1].strip() if cmd.str2bool(val) == True: ip = api.Call('report.host.attr',[node,'attr=hostaddr']) url = 'https://%s:2380' % (ip[0]) urls.append(url)
print 'FLANNEL_ETCD_ENDPOINTS="--etcd-endpoints=%s"' % ','.join(urls[:])
[Unit] Description=Flanneld overlay address etcd agent After=etcd.service Before=docker.service
[Service] EnvironmentFile=-/opt/kubernetes/etc/flannel ExecStart=/opt/kubernetes/bin/flanneld --ip-masq=true \ ${FLANNEL_ETCD_PREFIX} \ ${FLANNEL_ETCD_ENDPOINTS} \ ${FLANNEL_ETCD_CAFILE} \ ${FLANNEL_ETCD_KEYFILE} \ ${FLANNEL_ETCD_CERTFILE} Restart=always RestartSec=10 Type=notify
[Install] WantedBy=multi-user.target RequiredBy=docker.service
systemctl enable flanneld

post.file: [Service] EnvironmentFile=-/etc/sysconfig/docker-network ExecStart= ExecStart=/usr/bin/dockerd --storage-driver=overlay \ --insecure-registry &kube.master_ip;:5000 \ ${DOCKER_OPT_BIP} \ ${DOCKER_OPT_IPMASQ} \ ${DOCKER_OPT_MTU} \ -H tcp://0.0.0.0:2376 -H fd:// -D Restart=always RestartSec=10

[Service] EnvironmentFile=-/etc/sysconfig/docker-network ExecStart= ExecStart=/usr/bin/dockerd \ --storage-driver=overlay \ --tlsverify \ --tlscacert=/etc/docker/certs.d/ca.pem \ --tlscert=/etc/docker/certs.d/server-cert.pem \ --tlskey=/etc/docker/certs.d/server-key.pem \ ${DOCKER_OPT_BIP} \ ${DOCKER_OPT_IPMASQ} \ ${DOCKER_OPT_MTU} \ -H tcp://0.0.0.0:2376 -H fd:// -D Restart=always RestartSec=10

kickstart.boot:
/opt/kubernetes/bin/etcdctl mkdir &etcd.prefix;
NETWORK='{ "Network": "10.1.0.0/16", "SubnetLen": 24, "SubnetMin": "10.1.10.0", "SubnetMax": "10.1.30.0", "Backend": { "Type": "udp", "Port": 7890 } }'
echo ${NETWORK} | /opt/kubernetes/bin/etcdctl set &etcd.prefix;/config
systemctl daemon-reload systemctl restart etcd flanneld
/usr/share/flannel/mk-docker-opts.sh -i -d /etc/sysconfig/docker-network systemctl daemon-reload systemctl restart docker
